intro: Pentacalia novolanata, commonly known as the Hawaiian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its star-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
